New Records: Paul Stirling and Andrew Balbirnie made 101 for the first wicket, setting a new best for Ireland’s highest opening partnership against South Africa in ODI cricket
Key Match Events: Captain Paul Stirling starred with the bat, making 88 from 92 deliveries
Harry Tector’s rapid 60 from 48 was a welcome return to form for the 24-year-old
Mark Adair and Graham Hume quickly settled into their work with the new ball, picking up a wicket apiece
Kyle Verreynne (38) looked to find a way back for his team but couldn’t build on his start
Fionn Hand earned his first wicket on his ODI debut
Bjorn Fortuin (11) was bowled by Matthew Humphreys and Williams became Young’s third wicket
Hume picked up that wicket in the 47th over, delivering the perfect end to Ireland Men’s international year
Pre-Game Insights: Stirling earlier called correctly at the toss for the first time in five attempts
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland ensured a winning finish with a superb all-round performance, beating South Africa in convincing fashion
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland Men ended their ODI series against South Africa Men in style on Monday, claiming a 69-run victory in Abu Dhabi with 23 balls to spare
The match was played at the Zayed Cricket Stadium, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
